medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported low-grade fevers for the past 2 weeks, starting post-operatively after a right total knee replacement. He indicated that he was able to ambulate without pain and denied worsening symptoms around the knee. However, he experienced increasing jaundice over the last 2 days, which he had never experienced before, along with dark urine noticed the day prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis C, cirrhosis, right total knee replacement 2 weeks ago, hypertension, hyperlipidemia.
